metadata.description: Comprehensive analysis of Bluebook Tables T1-T5 for citation validation

T1.name: United States Jurisdictions
T1.description: Federal and state court reporters, statutory compilations, and administrative materials

supreme_court.name: Supreme Court (U.S.)
common_errors: Using unofficial reporter when U.S. is available
Incorrect spacing in 'S. Ct.' or 'L. Ed.'
Forgetting to include year in parentheses

gpt_prompts.validation: Validate that this Supreme Court citation uses 'U.S.' as the preferred reporter when available. Check: (1) Reporter abbreviation has proper periods and spacing, (2) Volume and page numbers are present, (3) Year is in parentheses at the end.
gpt_prompts.correction: If this citation uses an unofficial reporter (S. Ct., L. Ed., U.S.L.W.) and the case is in U.S. Reports, suggest changing to U.S. citation. Ensure proper Bluebook format with spaces and periods.
gpt_prompts.example: Brown v. Board of Education, 347 U.S. 483 (1954)

circuit_courts.name: Courts of Appeals (U.S. Circuits)
common_errors: Using 'F. Appx' instead of 'F. App'x' (apostrophe required)

gpt_prompts.validation: Verify this circuit court citation: (1) Reporter is F., F.2d, F.3d, or F. App'x, (2) Circuit is properly designated (e.g., '2d Cir.' not '2nd Cir.'), (3) Year follows circuit designation in parentheses.
gpt_prompts.correction: Check if 'F.2nd' or 'F.3rd' appears and change to 'F.2d' or 'F.3d'. Verify circuit abbreviation uses ordinal format (1st, 2d, 3d, 4th, etc.). Ensure apostrophe in 'F. App'x'.
gpt_prompts.example: United States v. Smith, 123 F.3d 456 (5th Cir. 1997)

district_courts.name: District Courts
common_errors: Omitting space in 'F. Supp.' or using 'F.Supp.'
Using 'F. Supp. 2nd' or 'F. Supp. 3rd' instead of '2d' or '3d'

gpt_prompts.validation: Check district court citation: (1) Reporter is F. Supp., F. Supp. 2d, F. Supp. 3d, F.R.D., or B.R., (2) Proper spacing after 'F.' and 'Supp.', (3) District designation is correct (e.g., 'S.D.N.Y.' for Southern District of New York), (4) Year included.
gpt_prompts.correction: Fix spacing in 'F. Supp.' (space after each period). Change '2nd/3rd' to '2d/3d'. Verify district abbreviation follows Bluebook Table T1.

federal_circuit.name: United States Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit

gpt_prompts.validation: Ensure Federal Circuit citations specify '(Fed. Cir. YEAR)' in the parenthetical, not just a numbered circuit.
gpt_prompts.correction: Add 'Fed. Cir.' designation if missing from parenthetical.
gpt_prompts.example: Apple Inc. v. Samsung Elecs. Co., 678 F.3d 1314 (Fed. Cir. 2012)

court_of_federal_claims.name: United States Court of Federal Claims
common_errors: Using old reporter abbreviations for recent cases

gpt_prompts.validation: For Court of Federal Claims cases after 1992, ensure 'Fed. Cl.' is used (not 'Cl. Ct.' or 'Ct. Cl.').
gpt_prompts.correction: Update reporter abbreviation to 'Fed. Cl.' for post-1992 cases.
gpt_prompts.example: Contractor v. United States, 45 Fed. Cl. 678 (2000)

court_of_international_trade.name: United States Court of International Trade
common_errors: Using alternative reporters when official is available

gpt_prompts.validation: Check that Court of International Trade citations use 'Ct. Int'l Trade' with apostrophe in 'Int'l'.
gpt_prompts.correction: Ensure apostrophe is present in "Int'l" and prefer official reporter when available.
gpt_prompts.example: Import Co. v. United States, 123 Ct. Int'l Trade 456 (1999)

United States Code.gpt_prompt: Validate U.S. Code citations: (1) Format is 'Title U.S.C. § Section', (2) Periods in U.S.C., (3) Section symbol present.

common_errors: Incorrect format for Pub. L. No.
Statutes at Large.gpt_prompt: Check Statutes at Large format: 'Pub. L. No. XXX-YYY, Volume Stat. Page (Year)'.

United States Code Annotated.gpt_prompt: For U.S.C.A. citations, include publisher (West) in parenthetical with year.

United States Code Service.gpt_prompt: For U.S.C.S. citations, include publisher (LexisNexis) in parenthetical with year.

common_errors: Missing spaces or periods in 'Pub. L. No.'
Session Laws (Congressional).gpt_prompt: Session law format should be 'Pub. L. No. Congress-Number, Volume Stat. Page (Year)'.

Code of Federal Regulations.gpt_prompt: C.F.R. format: 'Title C.F.R. § Section (Year)'. Year should reflect the edition consulted.

Federal Register.gpt_prompt: Federal Register format: 'Volume Fed. Reg. Page (Month Day, Year)'.

Executive Orders and Proclamations.gpt_prompt: Executive orders should cite to 3 C.F.R. when available, with E.O. number included.

Alabama.gpt_prompt: For Alabama citations, use Southern Reporter (So., So. 2d, So. 3d) with proper spacing. Include 'Ala.' for court designation in parenthetical.

common_errors: Using Pacific Reporter without Alaska designation
Alaska.gpt_prompt: Alaska citations use Pacific Reporter (P.2d, P.3d). Include 'Alaska' in parenthetical to distinguish from other Pacific states.

common_errors: Not distinguishing Court of Appeals from Supreme Court
Missing 'Rev. Stat. Ann.' in statutory citations
Arizona.gpt_prompt: Arizona uses Pacific Reporter. Distinguish Supreme Court (Ariz.) from Court of Appeals (Ariz. Ct. App.) in parenthetical.

Arkansas.gpt_prompt: Arkansas uses South Western Reporter (S.W., S.W.2d, S.W.3d). Ensure '2d' and '3d' not '2nd' or '3rd'.

common_errors: Confusing Cal. Stat. (session laws) with statutory codes
California.gpt_prompt: California has multiple codes (Cal. Civ. Code, Cal. Penal Code, etc.). Court of Appeal uses '4th' not '4d'. Distinguish Supreme Court (Cal.) from Courts of Appeal (Cal. Ct. App.).

Colorado.gpt_prompt: Colorado uses Pacific Reporter. Include proper court designation in parenthetical.

Connecticut.gpt_prompt: Connecticut uses Atlantic Reporter (A., A.2d, A.3d). Specify court in parenthetical.

Delaware.gpt_prompt: Delaware uses Atlantic Reporter. Include year in parenthetical.

common_errors: Confusing D.C. Court of Appeals with U.S. Court of Appeals for D.C. Circuit
District of Columbia.gpt_prompt: D.C. Court of Appeals is local court (uses A.2d, A.3d). Don't confuse with federal D.C. Circuit (uses F.2d, F.3d).

Florida.gpt_prompt: Florida uses Southern Reporter. Specify which District Court of Appeal (1st, 2d, 3d, 4th, 5th) in parenthetical.

Georgia.gpt_prompt: Georgia uses South Eastern Reporter (S.E., S.E.2d). Statutory code is O.C.G.A. (Official Code of Georgia Annotated).

Hawaii.gpt_prompt: Hawaii uses Pacific Reporter. Include 'Haw.' in parenthetical to distinguish from other Pacific jurisdictions.

Idaho.gpt_prompt: Idaho uses Pacific Reporter. Do not abbreviate 'Idaho' in citations.

Illinois.gpt_prompt: Illinois uses North Eastern Reporter (N.E., N.E.2d). Specify appellate district in parenthetical for appellate court cases.

Indiana.gpt_prompt: Indiana uses North Eastern Reporter. Include court designation in parenthetical.

Iowa.gpt_prompt: Iowa uses North Western Reporter. Do not abbreviate 'Iowa'.

Kansas.gpt_prompt: Kansas uses Pacific Reporter. Distinguish Supreme Court from Court of Appeals in parenthetical.

Kentucky.gpt_prompt: Kentucky uses South Western Reporter (S.W.2d, S.W.3d currently).

Louisiana.gpt_prompt: Louisiana uses Southern Reporter. Specify circuit for Courts of Appeal (1st, 2d, 3d, 4th, 5th Cir.).

Maine.gpt_prompt: Maine's highest court is the Supreme Judicial Court, uses Atlantic Reporter.

common_errors: Confusing Court of Appeals (highest court) with Court of Special Appeals (intermediate)
Maryland.gpt_prompt: Maryland's highest court is the Court of Appeals. Intermediate appellate is Court of Special Appeals. Use Atlantic Reporter.

Massachusetts.gpt_prompt: Massachusetts highest court is Supreme Judicial Court, uses North Eastern Reporter.

Michigan.gpt_prompt: Michigan uses North Western Reporter. Include court in parenthetical.

Minnesota.gpt_prompt: Minnesota uses North Western Reporter. Specify court designation.

Missouri.gpt_prompt: Missouri uses South Western Reporter. Specify district for Court of Appeals.

New Jersey.gpt_prompt: New Jersey uses Atlantic Reporter. Appellate Division uses N.J. Super.

common_errors: Confusing Court of Appeals (highest) with Appellate Division
Not specifying department for Appellate Division
New York.gpt_prompt: New York Court of Appeals (highest) uses N.E./N.Y. Appellate Division uses N.Y.S. series. Specify department (1st, 2d, 3d, 4th Dep't) for Appellate Division.

North Carolina.gpt_prompt: North Carolina uses South Eastern Reporter.

North Dakota.gpt_prompt: North Dakota uses North Western Reporter.

Ohio.gpt_prompt: Ohio uses North Eastern Reporter. State reporter is Ohio St. (with series). Do not abbreviate 'Ohio'.

Oklahoma.gpt_prompt: Oklahoma uses Pacific Reporter. Has separate Court of Civil Appeals and Court of Criminal Appeals.

common_errors: Confusing Superior Court with Commonwealth Court
Not specifying which intermediate appellate court
Pennsylvania.gpt_prompt: Pennsylvania has two intermediate appellate courts: Superior Court and Commonwealth Court. Uses Atlantic Reporter.

South Carolina.gpt_prompt: South Carolina uses South Eastern Reporter.

South Dakota.gpt_prompt: South Dakota uses North Western Reporter.

common_errors: Not specifying which Court of Appeals district
Confusing Supreme Court (civil) with Court of Criminal Appeals
Texas.gpt_prompt: Texas has Supreme Court (civil) and Court of Criminal Appeals (criminal). Specify court and district for Courts of Appeals. Uses South Western Reporter.

Utah.gpt_prompt: Utah uses Pacific Reporter. Do not abbreviate 'Utah'.

Washington.gpt_prompt: Washington uses Pacific Reporter. Specify division for Court of Appeals.

West Virginia.gpt_prompt: West Virginia's highest court is Supreme Court of Appeals. Uses South Eastern Reporter.

American Samoa.gpt_prompt: American Samoa citations use 'Am. Samoa' abbreviation, not 'A.S.' Abbreviate as shown in Table T1.

Canal Zone.note: Historical - Canal Zone no longer exists
Canal Zone.gpt_prompt: Canal Zone (C.Z.) citations are historical only. Used for pre-1979 materials.

Guam.gpt_prompt: Guam is not abbreviated in citations.

Navajo Nation.gpt_prompt: Navajo Nation is not abbreviated. Tribal court citations require specific formatting.

Northern Mariana Islands.gpt_prompt: Northern Mariana Islands abbreviates to 'N. Mar. I.' in citations.

Puerto Rico.gpt_prompt: Puerto Rico abbreviates to 'P.R.' Include language indication if decision is in Spanish.

Virgin Islands.gpt_prompt: Virgin Islands abbreviates to 'V.I.' with periods.

key_validation_points: Reporter abbreviations must have proper spacing and periods (e.g., 'F. Supp.' not 'F.Supp.')
Series numbers use '2d' and '3d' not '2nd' or '3rd'
Regional reporters require state/court designation in parenthetical
Year must be included in parenthetical
State abbreviations follow Table T1 exactly

T2.name: Foreign Jurisdictions
T2.note: Table T2 content is available online at the Bluebook website with jurisdiction-specific citation formats
T2.content_reference: Bluebook website provides detailed citation formats for foreign jurisdictions
common_errors: Using U.S. citation format for foreign cases
Missing required elements for specific jurisdictions

gpt_prompts.validation: For foreign jurisdiction citations, consult Bluebook Table T2 online for country-specific requirements. Common foreign jurisdictions include: United Kingdom (U.K.), European Union (E.U.), Canada, Australia, etc. Each has unique citation formats.
gpt_prompts.correction: Foreign citations require jurisdiction-specific formatting per Table T2. Identify the country and apply appropriate rules from Bluebook online Table T2.
gpt_prompts.general_guidance: Foreign case citations typically include: Case name, citation to reporter/court, jurisdiction designation, and year. Format varies significantly by country.

examples.UK: R v. Smith [2020] UKSC 15 (United Kingdom Supreme Court)
examples.Canada: R. v. Jones, [2020] 1 S.C.R. 123 (Canadian Supreme Court)
examples.Australia: Smith v. Jones (2020) 264 CLR 123 (High Court of Australia)
examples.Germany: BVerfG [German Constitutional Court], Case No. 1 BvR 123/20, Decision of Jan. 15, 2020
examples.France: Cass. civ. [Court of Cassation, Civil Chamber], Jan. 15, 2020, Bull. civ. I, No. 20-12345

T2.validation_notes: Table T2 is primarily available online. For comprehensive validation of foreign citations, reference the Bluebook website's Table T2 which provides detailed rules for major foreign jurisdictions worldwide.

T3.name: Intergovernmental Organizations
T3.description: Citation formats for international and intergovernmental organization materials

UN_Documents.gpt_prompt: U.N. documents cite as: U.N. Doc. [Symbol] (Date). Example: U.N. Doc. A/RES/70/1 (Sept. 25, 2015). Verify document symbol follows U.N. format.

General_Assembly_Official_Records.gpt_prompt: General Assembly Official Records cite as: U.N. GAOR, [session], [supplement], U.N. Doc. [symbol] (year).
General_Assembly_Official_Records.example: U.N. GAOR, 70th Sess., Supp. No. 1, U.N. Doc. A/70/1 (2015)

Security_Council_Official_Records.gpt_prompt: Security Council Official Records cite as: U.N. SCOR, [year], [meeting], U.N. Doc. [symbol].
Security_Council_Official_Records.example: U.N. SCOR, 70th Year, 7389th mtg., U.N. Doc. S/PV.7389 (Feb. 12, 2015)

Economic_and_Social_Council_Official_Rec.full_name: Economic and Social Council Official Records
Economic_and_Social_Council_Official_Rec.gpt_prompt: ECOSOC Official Records cite with 'U.N. ESCOR' and appropriate document symbol.

Trusteeship_Council_Official_Records.gpt_prompt: Trusteeship Council Official Records (historical) cite as: U.N. TCOR.

Judgments_Opinions_Orders.gpt_prompt: I.C.J. judgments cite as: Case Name, Year I.C.J. Page (Date of decision). Example: Corfu Channel (U.K. v. Alb.), 1949 I.C.J. 4 (Apr. 9).

Pleadings.gpt_prompt: I.C.J. pleadings cite as: Case Name, Year I.C.J. Pleadings Page.

Acts_and_Documents.gpt_prompt: I.C.J. Acts and Documents cite as: Year I.C.J. Acts & Docs. Page.

UN_Treaties.name: United Nations Treaty Series
common_errors: Not including treaty name and parties
UN_Treaties.gpt_prompt: U.N.T.S. citations: Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, Volume U.N.T.S. Page. Example: Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties, May 23, 1969, 1155 U.N.T.S. 331.
UN_Treaties.example: Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties, May 23, 1969, 1155 U.N.T.S. 331

T3.2_League_of_Nations.name: League of Nations
T3.2_League_of_Nations.note: Historical - League of Nations dissolved in 1946

PCIJ.name: Permanent Court of International Justice
PCIJ.gpt_prompt: P.C.I.J. citations include year, series (A, B, A/B, C, D, E, F), and number. Example: S.S. Lotus (Fr. v. Turk.), 1927 P.C.I.J. (ser. A) No. 10 (Sept. 7).
PCIJ.example: S.S. Lotus (Fr. v. Turk.), 1927 P.C.I.J. (ser. A) No. 10 (Sept. 7)

League_Treaty_Series.name: League of Nations Treaty Series
League_Treaty_Series.gpt_prompt: L.N.T.S. citations: Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, Volume L.N.T.S. Page.

EU_Courts.name: Court of Justice of the European Union and General Court

European_Court_Reports.note: E.C.R. publication ceased in 2011; cases now published online
European_Court_Reports.gpt_prompt: E.C.R. citations (through 2011): Case Name, Case No., Year E.C.R. Page-number. For post-2011, cite to ECLI or official website.
European_Court_Reports.example: Case C-26/62, Van Gend en Loos v. Nederlandse Administratie der Belastingen, 1963 E.C.R. 1

Common_Market_Law_Reports.gpt_prompt: C.M.L.R. (unofficial reporter) cite as: Case Name, Case No., Year C.M.L.R. Page.

Common_Market_Reports_CCH.gpt_prompt: CCH Common Market Reports cite as: Year Common Mkt. Rep. (CCH) ¶ paragraph number.

EU_Legislative_Acts.name: EU Legislative Acts and Official Journal

common_errors: Missing series designation (L for legislation, C for information)
Official_Journal.gpt_prompt: Official Journal citations: Title, Year O.J. (L/C) Issue, Page. 'L' series for legislation, 'C' series for information and notices. Example: Council Regulation 1234/2020, 2020 O.J. (L 280) 5.

Official_Journal_Special_Edition.gpt_prompt: Special Edition Official Journal cite with year, O.J. Spec. Ed., and page.

Parliamentary_Debates.gpt_prompt: European Parliament debates cite as: EUR. PARL. DEB. (debate no.) page (date).

COM_Documents.gpt_prompt: Commission documents cite as: EUR. PARL. Doc. (COM doc-no.) (year).

T3.4_European_Commission_Human_Rights.name: European Commission of Human Rights
T3.4_European_Commission_Human_Rights.note: Abolished in 1998; cases now heard by European Court of Human Rights

Decisions_and_Reports.gpt_prompt: European Commission of Human Rights (historical, pre-1998) cite as: Application No., Volume Eur. Comm'n H.R. Dec. & Rep. Page (Year).

Yearbook.gpt_prompt: Yearbook of the European Convention on Human Rights cite with volume, Y.B. Eur. Conv. on H.R., page, and year.

Reports_of_Judgments.gpt_prompt: ECtHR judgments cite as: Case Name v. Country, App. No. xxxxx/xx, Eur. Ct. H.R. (year) or cite to ¶ paragraph if available online. Include application number.
Reports_of_Judgments.example: Pretty v. United Kingdom, App. No. 2346/02, Eur. Ct. H.R. (2002)

European_Human_Rights_Reports.gpt_prompt: Unofficial reporter European Human Rights Reports cite as: Volume Eur. H.R. Rep. Page (Year).

Annual_Reports.gpt_prompt: Inter-American Commission on Human Rights reports cite with case name/number, report designation, OAS Doc. symbol, and year.
Annual_Reports.example: Case 12.345, Report No. 45/20, Inter-Am. Comm'n H.R., OEA/Ser.L/V/II, doc. 50 (2020)

Series_A_Judgments.name: Series A (Judgments and Opinions)
Series_A_Judgments.gpt_prompt: Inter-American Court Series A (judgments) cite as: Case Name, Inter-Am. Ct. H.R. (ser. A) No. XX, ¶ para (Month Day, Year).
Series_A_Judgments.example: Velásquez Rodríguez Case, Inter-Am. Ct. H.R. (ser. A) No. 1, ¶ 164 (July 29, 1988)

Series_B_Pleadings.name: Series B (Pleadings, Oral Arguments, and Documents)
Series_B_Pleadings.gpt_prompt: Series B contains pleadings and related documents.

Series_C_Decisions.name: Series C (Decisions and Judgments)
Series_C_Decisions.gpt_prompt: Series C (current series for decisions) cite as: Case Name, Inter-Am. Ct. H.R. (ser. C) No. XXX, ¶ para (Month Day, Year).

Series_D_Pleadings_C.name: Series D (Pleadings relative to Series C)
Series_D_Pleadings_C.gpt_prompt: Series D contains pleadings corresponding to Series C cases.

Series_E_Provisional.name: Series E (Provisional Measures)
Series_E_Provisional.gpt_prompt: Series E contains provisional measures orders.

T3.8_ITLOS.name: International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea

ITLOS_Reports.gpt_prompt: ITLOS cases cite as: Case Name, Case No., Year ITLOS Rep. Page (Month Day).
ITLOS_Reports.example: The M/V 'Saiga' (No. 2) Case (St. Vincent v. Guinea), Case No. 2, 1999 ITLOS Rep. 10 (July 1)

T3.9_Other_IGOs.name: Other Intergovernmental Organizations

IBRD.name: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank)

ICSID.name: International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes

T3.9_Other_IGOs.gpt_prompt: For other intergovernmental organizations not listed in T3.1-T3.8, use the organization's standard abbreviation and cite to official documents with document numbers and dates. Consult Bluebook Table T3.9 for specific organizations.

common_errors: Missing periods in abbreviations (e.g., 'UN' instead of 'U.N.')
Confusing different court reporters (I.C.J. vs. P.C.I.J.)

gpt_prompts.validation: For international organization citations, verify: (1) Correct abbreviation with periods, (2) Proper document symbol or case number, (3) Appropriate reporter or series, (4) Complete date information, (5) Compliance with specific T3 subsection rules.
gpt_prompts.correction: Check abbreviations match Table T3 exactly. Ensure document symbols follow organization's format. Include all required elements (case number, series, page, date).
gpt_prompts.general: International citations vary by organization. U.N. uses 'U.N. Doc.' with symbols. I.C.J. uses 'Year I.C.J. Page'. E.U. uses 'O.J.' for legislation. Always include periods in abbreviations.

T4.name: Treaty Sources
T4.description: Citation formats for international treaties and agreements

United_States_Treaties_and_Other_Interna.gpt_prompt: U.S.T. citations (1950-1984 only): Treaty Name, Country, Month Day, Year, Volume U.S.T. Page. Example: Treaty of Friendship, U.S.-Japan, Sept. 8, 1951, 3 U.S.T. 3169.
United_States_Treaties_and_Other_Interna.example: Treaty of Friendship, U.S.-Japan, Sept. 8, 1951, 3 U.S.T. 3169

Statutes_at_Large_Treaties.gpt_prompt: For treaties prior to 1950, cite to Statutes at Large: Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, Volume Stat. Page.
Statutes_at_Large_Treaties.example: Treaty of Paris, U.S.-Gr. Brit., Sept. 3, 1783, 8 Stat. 80

Treaties_and_Other_International_Acts_Se.gpt_prompt: T.I.A.S. citations (1945-present): Treaty Name, Parties, Month Day, Year, T.I.A.S. No. XXXX. This is a slip treaty format, each treaty gets a number.
Treaties_and_Other_International_Acts_Se.example: Agreement on Trade Relations, U.S.-China, July 7, 1979, T.I.A.S. No. 9630

Treaty_Series.gpt_prompt: T.S. citations (1778-1945): Treaty Name, Parties, Month Day, Year, T.S. No. XXX.
Treaty_Series.example: Treaty Name, U.S.-Country, Jan. 1, 1920, T.S. No. 123

Executive_Agreement_Series.gpt_prompt: E.A.S. citations (1922-1945) for executive agreements: Agreement Name, Parties, Month Day, Year, E.A.S. No. XXX.

common_errors: Using old 'S. Exec. Doc.' format for recent treaties
Senate_Treaty_Documents.gpt_prompt: Senate Treaty Documents (post-1981): Treaty Name, S. Treaty Doc. No. Congress-Number (Year). Include Congress number and document number.
Senate_Treaty_Documents.example: Convention on Climate Change, S. Treaty Doc. No. 102-38 (1992)

Senate_Executive_Documents.gpt_prompt: Senate Executive Documents (pre-1981): Treaty Name, S. Exec. Doc. No. Letter-Number, Congress (Year).
Senate_Executive_Documents.example: Treaty Name, S. Exec. Doc. No. A-1, 95th Cong. (1977)

United_Nations_Treaty_Series.gpt_prompt: U.N.T.S. is the primary source for multilateral treaties. Cite as: Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, Volume U.N.T.S. Page. Example: Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties, May 23, 1969, 1155 U.N.T.S. 331.
United_Nations_Treaty_Series.example: Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties, May 23, 1969, 1155 U.N.T.S. 331

League_of_Nations_Treaty_Series.gpt_prompt: L.N.T.S. (historical, 1920-1946): Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, Volume L.N.T.S. Page.

Pan_American_Treaty_Series.gpt_prompt: Pan-American Treaty Series cite with volume, Pan-Am. T.S., and page.

European_Treaty_Series.gpt_prompt: European Treaty Series cite as: Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, E.T.S. No. XXX.
European_Treaty_Series.example: European Convention on Human Rights, Nov. 4, 1950, E.T.S. No. 5

Organization_of_American_States_Treaty_S.gpt_prompt: O.A.S. Treaty Series cite with treaty name, date, and O.A.S.T.S. number.

Council_of_Europe_Treaty_Series.gpt_prompt: Council of Europe Treaty Series cite as: Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, C.E.T.S. No. XXX.

T4.3_Unofficial_Treaty_Sources.name: Unofficial Treaty Sources
T4.3_Unofficial_Treaty_Sources.note: Use only when official sources are unavailable

LEXIS_Treaties.name: U.S. Treaties on LEXIS
LEXIS_Treaties.gpt_prompt: When official print sources unavailable, cite to electronic database: Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, Lexis [document ID]. Indicate if available in print but you used electronic.

common_errors: Using I.L.M. when official source is available
International_Legal_Materials.gpt_prompt: I.L.M. is an unofficial source, use only when official unavailable. Cite as: Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, Volume I.L.M. Page.

Parrys_Consolidated_Treaty_Series.gpt_prompt: Parry's Consolidated Treaty Series (historical): Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, Volume Consol. T.S. Page.

Heins_Treaties.gpt_prompt: Hein's online collection: Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, Hein's No. KAV####.

Bevans.gpt_prompt: Bevans (compilation of early U.S. treaties 1776-1949): Treaty Name, Month Day, Year, Volume Bevans Page.
Bevans.example: Treaty of Ghent, U.S.-Gr. Brit., Dec. 24, 1814, 2 Bevans 42

elements: Ratification/entry into force date if relevant

common_errors: Using unofficial source when official is available
Italicizing treaty names (should not be italicized)
Not identifying parties for bilateral treaties
Using wrong source for time period (e.g., U.S.T. for pre-1950 or post-1984)

gpt_prompts.validation: Verify treaty citation: (1) Treaty name not italicized, (2) Parties identified if bilateral, (3) Full date (Month Day, Year), (4) Appropriate source for time period, (5) Proper abbreviation format with periods, (6) Volume and page/number included.
gpt_prompts.correction: Check treaty source matches signing date: Pre-1950 use Stat., 1950-1984 use U.S.T., 1945+ use T.I.A.S. For multilateral, cite to U.N.T.S. when available. Ensure abbreviations have periods.
gpt_prompts.general: Treaties cite to official sources first. Format: Treaty Name, Parties, Month Day, Year, Source. Don't italicize treaty names. Include volume and page or series number.

T5.name: Arbitral Reporters
T5.description: Citation formats for international arbitration decisions and awards

Arbitration_Materials.gpt_prompt: Arbitration Materials cite with case name, Arb. Mat'l citation, and date.

Hague_Court_Reports_First_Series.gpt_prompt: Hague Court Reports, First Series edited by James Brown Scott. Cite as: Case Name, Hague Ct. Rep. (Scott) Page (Year).
Hague_Court_Reports_First_Series.example: The Pious Fund Case (U.S. v. Mex.), Hague Ct. Rep. (Scott) 1 (1902)

Hague_Court_Reports_Second_Series.gpt_prompt: Hague Court Reports, Second Series. Cite as: Case Name, Hague Ct. Rep. 2d (Scott) Page (Year).

ICSID_Reports.full_name: International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes Reports
common_errors: Confusing ICSID Rep. with ICSID Rev.
ICSID_Reports.gpt_prompt: ICSID Reports contain investment dispute awards. Cite as: Case Name, ICSID Case No. ARB/XX/X, Volume ICSID Rep. Page (Year). Include case number and award type (Award, Decision on Jurisdiction, etc.).
ICSID_Reports.example: Compañía de Aguas del Aconquija S.A. v. Argentine Republic, ICSID Case No. ARB/97/3, 5 ICSID Rep. 3 (2000)

ICSID_Review.full_name: ICSID Review - Foreign Investment Law Journal
ICSID_Review.note: Journal, not reporter - use only when case not in ICSID Rep.
ICSID_Review.gpt_prompt: ICSID Review is a journal, not official reporter. Use only if case not available in ICSID Rep. Cite as: Case Name, Volume ICSID Rev. Page (Year).

ICC_Arbitration.gpt_prompt: ICC arbitration awards cite as: ICC Case No. XXXX, Int'l Comm. Arb. (or cite to publication in YCA, Mealey's, etc. if published). Include interim or final award designation.
ICC_Arbitration.example: ICC Case No. 1234, Final Award, Int'l Comm. Arb. (1990)

ITLOS_Reports.full_name: International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea Reports
ITLOS_Reports.gpt_prompt: ITLOS Reports cite as: Case Name, Case No. X, Year ITLOS Rep. Page (Month Day). Include case number and decision type.
ITLOS_Reports.example: The M/V 'Saiga' (No. 2) Case (St. Vincent v. Guinea), Case No. 2, 1999 ITLOS Rep. 10 (July 1)

ITA_Investment_Treaty_Cases.full_name: Investment Treaty Arbitration (ITA) - Investment Treaty Cases
ITA_Investment_Treaty_Cases.gpt_prompt: ITA is online resource. When citing unpublished investment treaty awards, may cite as: Case Name, ITA Inv. Treaty Cases (Date), [URL]. Prefer published sources when available.

PCA_Case_Repository.full_name: Permanent Court of Arbitration Case Repository
common_errors: Not specifying which PCA tribunal (UNCITRAL, bilateral treaty, etc.)
PCA_Case_Repository.gpt_prompt: PCA Case Repository citations for unpublished awards: Case Name, PCA Case No. XXXX-XX, Award/Decision (Date). Specify arbitration rules (UNCITRAL, bilateral investment treaty, etc.). Include URL for online-only materials.
PCA_Case_Repository.example: Abyei Arbitration (Sudan v. Sudan People's Liberation Movement/Army), PCA Case No. 2008-7, Final Award (July 22, 2009)

RIAA_UN_Reports.full_name: United Nations Reports of International Arbitral Awards
RIAA_UN_Reports.gpt_prompt: R.I.A.A. (U.N. compilation of arbitral awards): Case Name, Volume R.I.A.A. Page (Tribunal, Year). Include tribunal designation and year of award.
RIAA_UN_Reports.example: Island of Palmas Case (Neth. v. U.S.), 2 R.I.A.A. 829 (Perm. Ct. Arb. 1928)

World_Arbitration_Reporter.gpt_prompt: World Arbitration Reporter cite with issue number: Case Name, World Arb. Rep. (Issue) (Year).

elements: Decision type (Award, Interim Award, Decision on Jurisdiction, etc.)
general_arbitration_citation_notes.unpublished_awards: For unpublished awards, cite to party or publicly available source with descriptive parenthetical. Include case number, tribunal, and date.
general_arbitration_citation_notes.procedural_orders: Procedural orders generally not published; cite with case name, 'Procedural Order No. X', tribunal, and date.

common_errors: Not distinguishing between ICSID Rep. (reporter) and ICSID Rev. (journal)
Missing case numbers for institutional arbitrations
Not specifying type of decision (Award vs. Interim Award vs. Jurisdictional Decision)
Using unofficial sources when official reporter available
Missing periods in abbreviations (R.I.A.A., ICSID Rep.)

gpt_prompts.validation: For arbitral awards, verify: (1) Case name with parties, (2) Case number if institutional arbitration, (3) Type of decision specified, (4) Appropriate reporter abbreviation with periods, (5) Tribunal identified, (6) Complete date (Month Day, Year).
gpt_prompts.correction: Check reporter abbreviation: ICSID Rep. (not ICSID Rev. unless unavailable), R.I.A.A. with periods, proper spacing in 'Hague Ct. Rep.' Include case number for ICSID, ICC, PCA cases. Specify award type.
gpt_prompts.general: Arbitral awards cite to official reporter when available (ICSID Rep., R.I.A.A., ITLOS Rep.). Include case number, award type, tribunal, and date. For unpublished awards, cite to repository or party materials with descriptive information.

jurisdiction_overlap.note: Some materials appear in multiple tables

examples.ITLOS: Appears in both T3 (Intergovernmental Organizations) and T5 (Arbitral Reporters)
Appears in T3 under United Nations
Appears in both T3 (UN Treaties) and T4 (Treaty Sources)

citation_hierarchy.courts_and_tribunals: For court decisions, cite to official reporter when available, then regional/unofficial reporters
citation_hierarchy.treaties: Cite to official national source first, then intergovernmental source, then unofficial source
citation_hierarchy.arbitral_awards: Cite to official arbitral reporter when available, then compilations, then repositories

key_principles: All abbreviations must include proper periods and spacing
Series numbers use ordinal abbreviations: '2d' and '3d' not '2nd' or '3rd'
Years must be included in parentheticals for case citations
Jurisdictional or court designation required in parentheticals for regional reporters
Prefer official/primary sources over unofficial/secondary sources
State abbreviations must exactly match Table T1
Foreign and international citations have specific requirements per Tables T2-T5
common_global_errors: Missing or incorrect periods in abbreviations
Using unofficial sources when official available
Not matching exact abbreviation from tables
Confusing similar reporters (e.g., ICSID Rep. vs. ICSID Rev.)
Missing required identifiers (case numbers, document symbols, etc.)
